subject: Economics
title: Jiaozi: The World's First Paper Money
description: A 1-minute de-risking session on Jiaozi: The World's First Paper Money.

hook.text: In 11th-century China, merchants invented paper money because carrying 30 kilos of coins to market was exhausting.

buildup.text: The jiaozi was a deposit certificate â€” leave your coins with a merchant, carry the paper instead.

discovery.text: The Song dynasty government took over, printing official jiaozi backed by coin reserves. State paper money was born.

twist.text: Within 200 years, the government printed too much. Hyperinflation destroyed the currency.

climax.text: China invented paper money â€” and the danger of printing too much â€” 600 years before Europe.

punchline.text: Paper money was born from laziness and died from greed.

quiz.question: What ultimately destroyed China's first paper money system?
options: The government printed too much, causing hyperinflation
